definitions.definition: To stop , deflect or divert (something in progress or motion ).
examples: The police intercepted the package of stolen goods while it was in transit.

definitions.definition: To gain possession of (the ball) in a ball game .

subdefinitions.definition: Of a defensive player: to steal a pass thrown by the opposing team, gaining possession of the ball.

definitions.definition: To perform an aeronautical action in which a fighter approaches a suspicious aircraft to escort it away from a prohibited area, or approaches an enemy aircraft to shoot it down.

main_definition: ( transitive ) To stop , deflect or divert (something in progress or motion ).
secondary_definitions: ( transitive , sports ) To gain possession of (the ball) in a ball game .
( transitive , mathematics ) To take or comprehend between.
To perform an aeronautical action in which a fighter approaches a suspicious aircraft to escort it away from a prohibited area, or approaches an enemy aircraft to shoot it down.
